intro: Scorzonera nutans, commonly known as the nodding scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant features elongated, lobed leaves that are often hairy, and it produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Scorzonera nutans is known for its medicinal properties, with roots traditionally used in herbal remedies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats.
